author: Staff Reporter
text: Dheeran Chinnamalai Gounder Peravai leader Yuvaraj appeared before the Coimbatore TANPID court that is hearing a case related to his alleged involvement in an emu farm case. The Erode Economic Offences Wing Police had registered a case in 2012 against five persons including Yuvaraj that they swindled Rs. 2.70 crore investors money. The police arrested Yuvaraj, but he came out on bail. Meanwhile, he was arrested for his alleged involvement in the murder of Dalit youth Gokulraj. Following a TANPID court direction, he was produced before the court, which then posted the hearing for March 21.
title: Yuvaraj appears in court
